title: Easy Curry Sauce Recipe
description: This curry sauce is fragrant and rich, made with coriander, cumin, turmeric, garlic, and ginger, mixed with puréed tomatoes, chile pepper, and yogurt.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Sauces Easy Curry Sauce 4.0 (55) 50 Reviews 6 Photos This curry sauce is versatile and can be served as a main course with meats and vegetables or as a sauce for dipping or spicing up veggie side dishes. It's great over baked potatoes, too. Submitted by Lom Updated on April 5, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 4 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 tablespoons peanut oil 1 tablespoon margarine 1 large onion, chopped 2 tablespoons minced garlic 1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root 2 tablespoons ground coriander 2 tablespoons ground cumin 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 teaspoon ground black pepper 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper ¼ teaspoon ground turmeric 2 tomatoes 2 serrano chile peppers, seeded ½ cup fresh cilantro ½ cup yogurt, whisked until smooth 3 cups water Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat oil and margarine in a small skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add onion and sauté until very brown, 10 to 15 minutes; do not undercook or sauce will taste funny. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add garlic and ginger to onions; sauté for an additional 2 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Transfer mixture to a food processor and blend until smooth. Do not rinse the food processor. Place blended onion mixture in a large saucepan. Stir in coriander, cumin, cinnamon, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and turmeric; cook over low heat until mixture is thick and has a paste-like consistency. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Purée tomatoes, chile peppers, and cilantro in the food processor until smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add to onion mixture and stir over low heat, cooking off moisture from tomatoes and peppers. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add yogurt a little bit at a time, stirring constantly to avoid curdling. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Blend mixture in the food processor until smooth Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Return to saucepan, add water, and increase heat to high; bring sauce to a rolling boil. Cover saucepan and boil for 3 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Reduce heat and simmer until desired consistency is reached. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serving Suggestions: To serve with meat: Cook meat separately, then simmer in sauce for 5 to 10 minutes before serving over rice or with bread. To serve with vegetables: Steam raw veggies until tender, 4 to 5 minutes, then simmer in sauce for 5 to 10 minutes before serving. I Made It Print 112 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 75 Calories 6g Fat 6g Carbs 2g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 75 % Daily Value * Total Fat 6g 7% Saturated Fat 1g 5% Cholesterol 1mg 0% Sodium 35mg 2% Total Carbohydrate 6g 2% Dietary Fiber 1g 5% Protein 2g 3% Vitamin C 4mg 4% Calcium 69mg 5% Iron 2mg 8% Potassium 144mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Curry Sauce 01 of 06 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 06 Photo by  hagemannjenny 02/16/2022 I love this recipe and have had no issue with the cooking time. I whip this up on meal prep days to keep in the fridge for easy rice bowls and it tastes so elevated and fresh straight from the fridge. Anyone who’s looking for curry powder on a curry recipe needs to do some reading first before leaving a review IMO. This is a short list of ingredients for the flavor this recipe delivers. Yummmm! 03 of 06 Photo by  Christian3 04/10/2020 04 of 06 Photo by  R00dscreen 10/31/2019 05 of 06 Photo by  Todd Allen 03/12/2016 06 of 06 Photo by  Avon- status quo PRO 03/20/2011 Four stars overall.....5 for taste, 3 for preparation steps and amount of water. I streamlined the prep by cooking the onions, peppers and tomatoes along with the garlic and ginger first. Blended it, added back to the pan, simmered and added the rest of the spices and 1 1/2 cups of chicken broth. Also, I did add 1/4 tsp of baking soda to this to keep the tomatoes from curdling the yogurt. Add the yogurt last, stir til smooth and poured it over some chicken. Baked it in the oven and served over rice. 1 You’ll Also Love Spicy Tomato Chutney 17 Ratings Indian Relish 126 Ratings Lucy's Tomato and Peach Chutney 6 Ratings Peach Chutney 68 Ratings Thai Banana Salsa with King Prawns 16 Ratings Indian Vegetarian Curried Cauliflower 4 Ratings Roasted Pear Mango Chutney 5 Ratings Sambal Sauce 3 Ratings Filipino Lechon Sauce Sweet Chili Thai Sauce 190 Ratings Besan (Gram Flour) Halwa 19 Ratings Easy Coconut Ladoo Raita Sauce 1 Rating Rasgullas 5 Ratings Atta (Whole Wheat) Halwa 2 Ratings Green Chutney 52 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
